H0.text: The four radioactive series titled Thorium, Neptunium, Radium/Uranium and Actinium all decay eventually to stable isotopes of what element. Bismuth

H1.text: The four radioactive series titled Thorium, Neptunium, Radium/Uranium and Actinium all decay eventually to stable isotopes of what element. Mercury

H2.text: The four radioactive series titled Thorium, Neptunium, Radium/Uranium and Actinium all decay eventually to stable isotopes of what element. Tantalum

H3.text: The four radioactive series titled Thorium, Neptunium, Radium/Uranium and Actinium all decay eventually to stable isotopes of what element. LEad

A4.text: The thorium series terminates with lead-208, 6 alpha decays and 4 beta decays from thorium.

A5.text: The neptunium series terminates with thallium-205, 8 alpha decays and 4 beta decays from neptunium.

A6.text: The uranium series terminates with lead-206, the actinium series with lead-207, and the thorium series with lead-208.

A7.text: The neptunium series terminates with thallium-205, not a lead isotope.

A8.text: The thorium, uranium/radium, and actinium series each end with a specific lead isotope.

A9.text: The National Nuclear Data Center – freely available databases that can be used to check or construct decay chains

A10.text: IAEA – Live Chart of Nuclides (with decay chains)

A11.text: The three isotopes lead-206, lead-207, and lead-208 represent the ends of three decay chains: the uranium series (or radium series), the actinium series, and the thorium series, respectively; a fourth decay chain, the neptunium series, terminates with the thallium isotope 205Tl.
